Package com.pandora.general.logic

Class ShearStressLogicImpl

java.lang.Object
com.pandora.general.logic.ShearStressLogicImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
ShearStressLogic
@Component public class ShearStressLogicImpl extends Object implements ShearStressLogic
The ShearStressLogicImpl class is an implementation of the ShearStressLogic interface, providing methods to calculate shear stress, critical shear stress for sediment transport, and the Shields parameter based on specified parameters. It is annotated as a Spring component and serves as a logic component for shear stress-related calculations.
Version:
0.0.1
Author:
Wim Joost van Hoek

  • Method Details

    • calculateShearStress

      public double calculateShearStress(double mu, double kappa)
      Calculates the shear stress based on the given dynamic viscosity and von Kármán constant.
      Specified by:
      calculateShearStress in interface ShearStressLogic
      Parameters:
      mu - the dynamic viscosity of the fluid.
      kappa - the von Kármán constant.
      Returns:
      the calculated shear stress. Implementation note: The shear stress is computed using the formula: mu * (1 / kappa) * 10.

    • calculateCriticalShearStress

      public double calculateCriticalShearStress(double rhoP, double g, double r, double theta, double thetaC)
      Calculates the critical shear stress for sediment transport based on the given parameters. The critical shear stress is computed using the formula: rhoP * g * 2 * r * (theta - thetaC).
      Specified by:
      calculateCriticalShearStress in interface ShearStressLogic
      Parameters:
      rhoP - the density of the sediment particles.
      g - the acceleration due to gravity.
      r - the particle radius.
      theta - the angle of repose of the sediment.
      thetaC - the critical angle of repose.
      Returns:
      the calculated critical shear stress.

    • calculateShieldsParameter

      public double calculateShieldsParameter(double tau, double rhoP, double g, double r)
      Calculates the Shields parameter, a dimensionless parameter used in sediment transport analysis.
      Specified by:
      calculateShieldsParameter in interface ShearStressLogic
      Parameters:
      tau - the shear stress.
      rhoP - the density of the sediment particles.
      g - the acceleration due to gravity.
      r - the particle radius.
      Returns:
      the calculated Shields parameter. Implementation note: The Shields parameter is computed using the formula: tau / (rhoP * g * 2 * r).
